channel.title: Comments on: Install, configure and run MySQL Cluster – demo video
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../install-configure-and-run-mysql-cluster-demo-video/index.html#comment-427">MySQLDB</a>.
No video for installing a multiple node Cluster but you can follow the instructions from <a href="./../deploying-mysql-cluster-over-multiple-hosts/"/index.html target="_blank" rel="nofollow">./../deploying-mysql-cluster-over-multiple-hosts/</a>/index.html
item.content:encoded:
In reply to MySQLDB.

No video for installing a multiple node Cluster but you can follow the instructions from ./../deploying-mysql-cluster-over-multiple-hosts/index.html

item.title: By: MySQLDB
item.dc:creator: MySQLDB
item.description:
Thanks Andrew ,
Such a great video , Successfully Installed MySQL Cluster on centos for single
Is there any video for multiple host cluster installation
item.content:encoded:
Thanks Andrew ,

Such a great video , Successfully Installed
MySQL Cluster on centos for single

Is there any video for multiple host cluster
installation

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../install-configure-and-run-mysql-cluster-demo-video/index.html#comment-425">deepak</a>.
deepak,
as a first step to get Cluster up and running on Cluster (all processes on a single host) you can follow the quick start guides from <a href="./../../mysql/download-install-configure-run-and-test-mysql-cluster-in-under-15-minutes/"/index.html rel="nofollow">MySQL Cluster Quick Start</a> and see this blog on <a href="./../running-mysql-cluster-over-multiple-servers/"/index.html rel="nofollow">running MySQL Cluster across multiple Windows servers</a>.
Regards, Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to deepak.

deepak,

as a first step to get Cluster up and running on Cluster (all processes on a single host) you can follow the quick start guides from MySQL Cluster Quick Start and see this blog on running MySQL Cluster across multiple Windows servers.

Regards, Andrew.

item.title: By: deepak
item.dc:creator: deepak
item.description: can any one send me the configuration for mysql cluster in windows. i am using mysql 5.1.56 and cluster 7.1.14
item.content:encoded:
can any one send me the configuration for mysql cluster in windows.
i am using mysql 5.1.56 and cluster 7.1.14

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../install-configure-and-run-mysql-cluster-demo-video/index.html#comment-423">Luke</a>.
Hi Luke,
Not tried this on CentOS but would expect it to work.
Is user1 your username and /home/user1 your home directory?
You need to start the data nodes between the ndb_mgmd and the mysqld - did you do that?
Regards, Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Luke.

Hi Luke,

Not tried this on CentOS but would expect it to work.

Is user1 your username and /home/user1 your home directory?

You need to start the data nodes between the ndb_mgmd and the mysqld – did you do that?

Regards, Andrew.

item.title: By: Luke
item.dc:creator: Luke
item.description:
Hi, i'm stuck at start mgmd server.. ##################################### [user1@centOS mysqlc]$ cd ../my_cluster/ [user1@centOS my_cluster]$ $HOME/mysqlc/bin/ndb_mgmd -f conf/config.ini --initial --configdir=$HOME/my_cluster/conf/ MySQL Cluster Management Server mysql-5.1.47 ndb-7.1.8 [user1@centOS my_cluster]$ ###################################### therefore i cant successfully execute
$HOME/mysqlc/bin/mysqld --defaults-file=conf/my.cnf &
#################################### and the return error i get: ###################### [user1@centOS my_cluster]$ $HOME/mysqlc/bin/mysqld --defaults-file=conf/my.cnf & [1] 3363 [user1@centOS my_cluster]$ 101015 13:57:06 [Warning] Can't create test file /home/user1/my_cluster/mysql_data/centOS.lower-test 101015 13:57:06 [Warning] Can't create test file /home/user1/my_cluster/mysql_data/centOS.lower-test /home/user1/mysqlc/bin/mysqld: Can't change dir to '/home/user1/my_cluster/mysql_data/' (Errcode: 2) 101015 13:57:06 [ERROR] Aborting
101015 13:57:06 [Note] /home/user1/mysqlc/bin/mysqld: Shutdown complete
[1]+ Exit 1 $HOME/mysqlc/bin/mysqld --defaults-file=conf/my.cnf [user1@centOS my_cluster]$
#################################
Your help are really needed! if u have yahoo messenger: add me. my ID: luqmanawawi
item.content:encoded:
Hi, i’m stuck at start mgmd server..
#####################################
[user1@centOS mysqlc]$ cd ../my_cluster/
[user1@centOS my_cluster]$ $HOME/mysqlc/bin/ndb_mgmd -f conf/config.ini –initial –configdir=$HOME/my_cluster/conf/
MySQL Cluster Management Server mysql-5.1.47 ndb-7.1.8
[user1@centOS my_cluster]$
######################################
therefore i cant successfully execute

$HOME/mysqlc/bin/mysqld –defaults-file=conf/my.cnf &

####################################
and the return error i get:
######################
[user1@centOS my_cluster]$ $HOME/mysqlc/bin/mysqld –defaults-file=conf/my.cnf &
[1] 3363
[user1@centOS my_cluster]$ 101015 13:57:06 [Warning] Can’t create test file /home/user1/my_cluster/mysql_data/centOS.lower-test
101015 13:57:06 [Warning] Can’t create test file /home/user1/my_cluster/mysql_data/centOS.lower-test
/home/user1/mysqlc/bin/mysqld: Can’t change dir to ‘/home/user1/my_cluster/mysql_data/’ (Errcode: 2)
101015 13:57:06 [ERROR] Aborting

101015 13:57:06 [Note] /home/user1/mysqlc/bin/mysqld: Shutdown complete

[1]+ Exit 1 $HOME/mysqlc/bin/mysqld –defaults-file=conf/my.cnf
[user1@centOS my_cluster]$

#################################

Your help are really needed!
if u have yahoo messenger: add me.
my ID: luqmanawawi

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../install-configure-and-run-mysql-cluster-demo-video/index.html#comment-421">Christopher Soniat</a>.
Hi Chris,
I haven't produced one - don't know if there's one available somewhere.
Regards, Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Christopher Soniat.

Hi Chris,

I haven’t produced one – don’t know if there’s one available somewhere.

Regards, Andrew.

item.title: By: Christopher Soniat
item.dc:creator: Christopher Soniat
item.description:
Andrew,
Is there a similar video for the ODBC functionality? I'm assuming that this also needs to be installe on the server, perhaps I am mistaken.
Thanks, Chris Soniat
item.content:encoded:
Andrew,

Is there a similar video for the ODBC functionality? I’m assuming that this also needs to be installe on the server, perhaps I am mistaken.

Thanks,
Chris Soniat

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../install-configure-and-run-mysql-cluster-demo-video/index.html#comment-419">Tom</a>.
Hi Tom,
take a look at the quick start guides at http://www.mysql.com/downloads/cluster/ (that same page has the downloads. Just select the OS and then grab the tar ball or zip that matches your architecture. Go for the latest GA release there (currently 7.1).
Regards, Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Tom.

Hi Tom,

take a look at the quick start guides at http://www.mysql.com/downloads/cluster/ (that same page has the downloads. Just select the OS and then grab the tar ball or zip that matches your architecture. Go for the latest GA release there (currently 7.1).

Regards, Andrew.

item.title: By: Tom
item.dc:creator: Tom
item.description: It would be nice if it showed which cluster software to download. Nothing on MySQL's site matches what is shown in the Linux section.
item.content:encoded: It would be nice if it showed which cluster software to download. Nothing on MySQL’s site matches what is shown in the Linux section.
